snippet: Judge Jones, a leading proponent of measures to prevent wrongful convictions, first came to public attention in 2005, when he issued an injunction against a transit strike, which was defied by workers.
abstract: Theodore T Jones Jr, judge on New York State's Court of Appeals, dies at age 68.
lead_paragraph: Judge Jones, a leading proponent of measures to prevent wrongful convictions, first came to public attention in 2005, when he issued an injunction against a transit strike, which was defied by workers.

headline.seo: Theodore T. Jones Jr., New York Appeals Court Judge, Dies at 68
headline.main: Theodore T. Jones Jr., Judge on New York’s Top Court, Dies at 68
headline.print_headline: Theodore T. Jones Jr., 68, New York Appeals Court Judge
